content: Breadcrumbs display a hierarchy of links. They are built using the `Breadcrumbs` and `BreadcrumbItem` components. The last item is automatically considered the current page.
Breadcrumbs support different `sizes`, `colors`, `variants` (solid, bordered, light), and `underline` options. The separator between items can also be customized with the `separator` prop.
For long paths, breadcrumbs can be collapsed. Use `maxItems` to set the visible limit, and `itemsBeforeCollapse` and `itemsAfterCollapse` to control how many items are shown at the start and end.
You can programmatically control the current/active item by using the `isCurrent` prop on a `BreadcrumbItem` and handling the `onAction` event on the main `Breadcrumbs` component.
The `Breadcrumbs` component has slots like `base`, `list`, and `ellipsis`. The `BreadcrumbItem` has slots like `base`, `item`, and `separator` for granular styling.
Breadcrumbs are implemented as an ordered list with full keyboard support. The current page is automatically marked with `aria-current` for screen readers.
